00041 #ifndef _exception_h
00042 #define _exception_h
00043 
00044 #include "crossplatformexport.h"
00045 #include "datatypes.h"
00046 
00047 #include <exception>
00048 
00049 
00050 namespace phys
00051 {
00052     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00053     /// @class Exception
00054     /// @headerfile exception.h
00055     /// @brief This is the exception thrown by most physgame system that can throw exceptions.
00056     /// @details In general they work like std::exception, but also track whether they have been logged yet.
00057     class PHYS_LIB Exception : public std::exception
00058     {
00059         private:
00060             /// @internal
00061             /// @brief This stores the Error Message
00062             String ErrorMessage;
00063 
00064             bool Logged;
00065         public:
00066             /// @brief Simple Constructor.
00067             /// @param Message The Error you want stored in the exception.
00068             /// @param Logged_ Has this exception already been sent to tthe logger
00069             Exception(const String &Message, bool Logged_ = false);
00070 
00071             /// @brief Retrieves the error message.
00072             /// @return This returns a string that is the stored error message.
00073             virtual String what() throw();
00074 
00075             /// @brief Has this exception been on a trip through the Logger?
00076             /// @return A bool storing true if it has and false if it has not.
00077             bool HasBeenLogged();
00078 
00079             ~Exception() throw();
00080 
00081 
00082     };// \Exception
00083 } // \phys
00084 
00085 #endif // \exception_cpp
